title: Bayesian Elicitation
abstract: We study how a decision-maker can acquire more information from an agent by reducing her own ability to observe what the agent transmits. In a large class of binary-action games, opacity design is just as good as full commitment to actions and also guarantees that ex ante information acquisition always benefits the receiver, even though without opacity design this learning might actually lower the receiver's expected payoff.

Title: Bayesian Elicitation
Abstract: We study how a decision-maker can acquire more information from an agent by reducing her own ability to observe what the agent transmits. In a large class of binary-action games, opacity design is just as good as full commitment to actions and also guarantees that ex ante information acquisition always benefits the receiver, even though without opacity design this learning might actually lower the receiver's expected payoff.
translated_abstract: 我们研究了决策者如何通过减少自己观察代理人传递信息的能力来获取更多信息。在一个大类的二元行动游戏中，不透明设计与完全承诺行动一样好，并且保证了即使在没有不透明设计的情况下，学习可能会降低接收者的预期收益，但次前信息获取仍然对接收者有利。
tldr: 该论文研究了决策者如何通过减少自身观察能力来获取更多信息，并发现在某些二元行动游戏中，不透明设计可以与完全承诺行动达到相同效果，并保证了信息获取对接收者有利。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates how a decision-maker can acquire more information by reducing their ability to observe an agent, and finds that in certain binary-action games, opacity design can be as effective as full commitment to actions, ensuring that information acquisition benefits the receiver.
